Class
Packet::MetaPimp
In: framework/meta_pimp.rb
Parent: Packet::Pimp

Class acts as a pimp for workers, which doesn‘t have a manually created pimp The idea behind a manually added pimp is to let client handle low level messaging beween workers. A meta pimp, does it for you.

Methods
  • handle_object
  • pimp_init
  • process_request
  • process_response
  • receive_data
  • save_worker_result
  • save_worker_status
  • send_request
Attributes
[RW] callback_hash initializer of pimp
[RW] worker_key
[RW] worker_status
Public Instance methods
handle_object(data_options = {})

[ show source ]

    # File framework/meta_pimp.rb, line 24
24:   def handle_object data_options = {}
25:     case data_options[:type]
26:     when :request
27:       process_request(data_options)
28:     when :response
29:       process_response(data_options)
30:     when :status
31:       save_worker_status(data_options)
32:     when :result
33:       save_worker_result(data_options)
34:     end
35:   end

    # File framework/meta_pimp.rb, line 8
 8:   def pimp_init
 9:     @callback_hash ||= {}
10:     @worker_status = nil
11:     @worker_result = nil
12:     @worker_key = nil
13:     @tokenizer = BinParser.new
14:   end
process_request(data_options = {})

[ show source ]

    # File framework/meta_pimp.rb, line 46
46:   def process_request(data_options = {})
47:     if requested_worker = data_options[:requested_worker]
48:       reactor.live_workers[requested_worker].send_request(data_options)
49:       #workers[requested_worker].send_request(data_options)
50:     end
51:   end
process_response(data_options = {})

[ show source ]

    # File framework/meta_pimp.rb, line 53
53:   def process_response(data_options = {})
54:     if callback_signature = data_options[:callback_signature]
55:       callback = callback_hash[callback_signature]
56:       callback.invoke(data_options)
57:     elsif client_signature = data_options[:client_signature]
58:       reactor.connections[client_signature].instance.worker_receive(data_options)
59:     end
60:   end
receive_data(p_data)

will be invoked whenever there is a response from the worker

[ show source ]

    # File framework/meta_pimp.rb, line 17
17:   def receive_data p_data
18:     @tokenizer.extract(p_data) do |b_data|
19:       t_data = Marshal.load(b_data)
20:       handle_object(t_data)
21:     end
22:   end

send_request(data_options = { })

can be used to send request to correspoding worker

[ show source ]

    # File framework/meta_pimp.rb, line 63
63:   def send_request(data_options = { })
64:     if callback = data_options[:callback]
65:       callback_hash[callback.signature] = callback
66:       data_options.delete(:callback)
67:       data_options[:callback_signature] = callback.signature
68:       send_data(data_options)
69:     else
70:       send_data(data_options)
71:     end
72:   end
